High Tide: The damage is @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d8[bludgeoning]|options:high-tide-power] damage and you ride the dragon, moving along with it but losing your balance. You become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the end of your next turn.

Low Tide: The dragon ends its movement in your space, where it guards you. You gain greater cover from the dragon until the end of your next turn or until you move out of the dragon's space, whichever comes first. The dragon doesn't provide cover to anyone else.

Critical Success The foe is unaffected.

Success The foe takes half damage and you move them 5 feet.

Failure The foe takes full damage and you move them 10 feet.

Critical Failure The foe takes double damage and you move them 20 feet.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6, or 1d8 in high tide.
Immortal Water Dragon.name: Immortal Water Dragon

Implant Taboo.name: Implant Taboo
Implant Taboo.description:
Trigger A foe within 60 feet takes a move action, takes an attack action, takes a skill action, casts a spell, or uses an activity containing a move action, an attack action, a skill action, or a spell.

You tap into your foe's mind and make their choice of action feel like an unforgivable taboo, potentially forcing the creature to change their action. The creature must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save with the following effects.

Critical Success The foe is unaffected.

Success The foe feels uneasy about their actions and hesitates. They can choose to either become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} or to take the effects of failure.

Failure The foe can't bring themself to take the triggering action, or a similar action. The foe must choose a different action instead, and they can't use another corresponding action this turn (a move action, attack action, skill action, or spell). If the trigger was an activity that contained more than one of the above types of action, choose one of them to become taboo. The reaction occurs before the foe spends their actions, so they don't lose any actions when they pivot to a new action.

Critical Failure As failure, but the foe wastes 1 action hesitating over the taboo; even if the trigger was a two-action activity or a three-action activity, the foe only wastes 1 action.

Imprison in Thorns.name: Imprison in Thorns
Imprison in Thorns.description:
You imprison your foe in living thorns. Choose a foe within 60 feet. The target is affected depending on its Reflex save. Any Interact actions to remove the prison or attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} the prison cause the creature attempting the action to take @Damage[(ceil(@actor.level/2))[piercing]] damage.

Choose to either sow or harvest.

  • Sow: You sow in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] around your target. 
  • Harvest: You harvest either in the foe's space or in an adjacent square to increase the thorn prison's effects. Interact actions to remove the prison or attempts to Escape the prison cause the creature attempting the action to take piercing damage equal to your level, instead of half your level.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is only slightly imprisoned. The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it, or another adjacent creature, spends an Interact action to remove the prison.

Failure The target is imprisoned more deeply. The target is immobilized until it, or another adjacent creature, spends a total of two Interact actions to remove the prison, or until the target successfully Escapes against your power DC, whichever comes first. A failed Escape substitutes for one of the Interact actions needed to remove the prison. The only actions the target can take are Interact or Escape actions to remove the prison.

Critical Failure As failure, except it takes four Interact actions or a successful Escape against your power DC, instead of two.

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1.

Incandescent Guardian.name: Incandescent Guardian
Incandescent Guardian.description:
You conjure an incandescent guardian that clings to a foe, damaging them and revealing their attacks. Choose a foe within 120 feet. You deal @Damage[(2+@actor.level)d8[fire]] damage, with effects depending on their @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

Critical Success The foe is unaffected.

Success You deal half fire damage to the foe, and the foe is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.5tWqbv3Iu1FlrOx6]{Limned} until the end of your next turn. You can choose to deal no fire damage to the foe instead of half damage; if you choose to do so, you and your allies gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the foe until the end of your next turn, as long as it remains limned.

Failure You deal full fire damage to the foe, and the foe is limned until the end of your next turn. During that time, as long as it remains limned, you and your allies gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the foe.

Critical Failure You deal double fire damage to the foe, and the foe is limned until the end of your turn after next (for 2 rounds and then until the end of your turn). During that time, as long as it remains limned, you and your allies gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the foe.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.Ei9t00REcjAiEnmM]{Effect: Incandescent Guardian}

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d8.

Ineluctable Flight.name: Ineluctable Flight
Ineluctable Flight.description:
As you gather and arrange the ambient air energy, almost nothing can stop you from moving. Choose a location you can see within 100 feet. You float on the winds to that location, ignoring difficult terrain, greater difficult terrain, hazardous terrain, and other similar terrain effects.

Since you're flying on the winds, you can move to locations that are hard to reach, even if you ordinarily couldn't walk to them. You can't move through completely solid objects, but you can fit through tiny cracks like a creature using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.V8wXOsoejQhe6CyG]{Vapor Form}. Your movement doesn't trigger reactions or free actions of any kind (even those that aren't triggered by movement).

You Refresh your powers.

Inexorable Demise.name: Inexorable Demise
Inexorable Demise.description:
You call upon the eventual inexorable demise of all living things, hanging a creature's death over them like a sword of Damocles until they face the reaper's scythe. Three ominous skulls appear over the head of a creature you choose within 60 feet. At the end of each of the creature's turns, a mournful bell tolls as one of the skulls burns up and disappears. After the last skull disappears, a scythe of void energy reaps the creature's life force, dealing @Damage[(2+@actor.level)d12[void]] damage, with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save. You can cancel the effect and spare the creature at any time before the last skull disappears by using a single action, which has the concentrate trait.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.laqtHcTDdj2GdjpC]{Effect: Inexorable Demise}

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d12.

Inferno.name: Inferno
Inferno.description:
You bring forth a widespread inferno across multiple areas nearby. Flames burn and consume creatures within up to six @Template[type:burst|distance:10]{10-foot radius bursts} all within 120 feet. You deal @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d4[fire]] damage, as well as @Damage[(4+(floor(@actor.level/2)))[persistent,fire]]{persistent fire} damage equal to 4 plus half your level to all creatures in the area, with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save. Even if a creature is in the area of multiple bursts, they still only take damage once.

Level (+1) The normal damage increases by 1d4.

Infused Ground.name: Infused Ground
Infused Ground.description: You infuse the ground around you with elemental energy, transforming it into hazardous terrain as you manipulate the energy to refresh your powers. You Refresh your powers. Until the beginning of your next turn, the ground in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] becomes hazardous terrain, dealing @Damage[4[untyped]] damage of your element's associated type. At 14th level, the damage increases to @Damage[5[untyped]], at 17th level, it increases to @Damage[6[untyped]], and at 20th level, it increases to @Damage[7[untyped]].

Intensify Cold.name: Intensify Cold
Intensify Cold.description: You connect yourself into the cold air around you and the frozen foes you've chilled. All foes within 30 feet with the frozen condition from your ice powers must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save against your power DC or increase their frozen condition by 3, or 1 on a success, and 0 on a critical success. Unfrozen foes in the area that are within 10 feet of either you or a frozen foe must succeed at a Fortitude save against your power DC or become @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 1}. You Refresh your powers.

Intensify Glare.name: Intensify Glare
Intensify Glare.description:
Trigger A creature within 60 feet succeeds at a flat check from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} condition caused by your light powers.

You intensify the glare from your light at the last second, throwing off the creature's attack even more. The creature must roll the flat check from the dazzled condition again and take the second result. The DC of the second @Check[type:flat|dc:7] check increases from 5 to 7.

Intrusive Analysis.description:
You intrude into your foe's mind, damaging them and allowing you to predict their every action for a short time. Choose a foe within 60 feet. They take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[mental]] damage, with effects depending on their @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

Critical Success The foe is unaffected.

Success The foe takes half damage, and you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your AC and saves against the foe until the beginning of your next turn.

Failure The foe takes full damage and you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your power attack rolls, AC, and saves against the foe until you refresh.

Critical Failure The foe takes double damage and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your power attack rolls, AC, and saves against the foe until you refresh.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.6HeqeFhufTRavbAF]{Effect: Intrusive Analysis}

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.
Intrusive Analysis.name: Intrusive Analysis

Irkalla.name: Irkalla
Irkalla.description: You call upon a portion of the underworld as the ground around you fades to a wispy and ominous white. The area on the ground within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:60] becomes an annex of the underworld for 1 minute. Your foes take @Damage[20[void]] damage at the start of each of their turns in the area. A foe who takes damage in this way is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (your choice) for 1 round. The area is also hazardous terrain to your foes, dealing @Damage[2[void]] damage for every square that the foe enters.

Jolting Embrace.description:
You surround yourself with electricity in order to shock all those who dare attack you. Until you refresh, adjacent creatures that hit you with a melee attack, as well as creatures that touch you or hit you with an unarmed attack, take @Damage[@actor.level[electricity]] damage and then become @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.1fZbuJEbVmE3J4XL]{Shocked} for 1 round. Choose one:

  • You either become @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Bi2aHykg6CZrQCnR]{Charged}
  • You discharge to increase the damage to @Damage[(1d6+@actor.level)[electricty]]; this improves to @Damage[(1d8+@actor.level)[electricty]] at 12th level, @Damage[(1d10+@actor.level)[electricty]] at 15th level, and @Damage[(1d12+@actor.level)[electricty]] at 18th level.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1.
Jolting Embrace.name: Jolting Embrace

Jumbling Threads.name: Jumbling Threads
Jumbling Threads.description:
You spray threads of force in a cone, assailing your foes and jumbling them through the area. You deal @Damage[((1+@actor.level)d4 +ceil(@actor.level/2))[force]] damage to all foes in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15], with effects depending on their @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

At 5th level, you can choose to increase the size of the cone to a @Template[type:cone|distance:20] when you use Jumbling Threads, and every 4 levels thereafter you can increase the size of the cone by 5 additional feet, to a maximum of 35 feet at 17th level.

Allies in the cone take no damage, and if they're willing, you can reposition them up to 10 feet to another space within the cone.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and you can reposition them up to 5 feet to another space within the cone.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and you can reposition them up to 10 feet to another space within the cone.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1.

Kamaitachi.name: Kamaitachi
Kamaitachi.description:
You conjure a powerful flensing dust devil with the vicious tenacity of a legendary weasel. The dust devil appears within 1,000 feet, occupies a 15-foot by 15-foot area, similar to the size of a Huge creature, and lasts until you refresh. Just after using this power, and then again at the beginning of each of your turns, you can use a free action, which has the concentrate trait, to move the dust devil up to 60 feet in any direction, including vertically, though the dust devil dies out if it ever moves more than 1,000 feet from your position. All foes that come within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:15] of the dust devil take @Damage[floor(@actor.level/2)d10[slashing]] damage with a @Check[type:Reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save; they take damage only once per round, regardless of how many times they come near the dust devil. If the dust devil intersects with an ally's space during its movement, and the ally is willing, the dust devil can lift the ally up, depositing them in one of the spaces when it ends its movement. The dust devil can lift up to 1 Huge ally, 2 Large allies, or 4 Medium or smaller allies at a time.

Level (20th) The damage increases by 1d10.

Killing Embrace.name: Killing Embrace
Killing Embrace.description:
You surround yourself with a pall of death, forcing those who attack you to pay with their life. Until you refresh, adjacent creatures that hit you with a melee attack, as well as creatures that touch you or hit you with an unarmed attack, take @Damage[@actor.level[void]] damage and become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (your choice) until the end of their turn.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1.

Kunlun.name: Kunlun
Kunlun.description:
You call forth a small mountain in the shape of an enormous magnificent pillar that towers into the sky, with a gemlike facade adorned with symbols of mysticism and elemental energy. The pillar emerges from the ground within 200 feet and lasts for 1 minute. It has a @Template[type:burst|distance:60]{60-foot radius), with a height of your choosing, up to 180 feet if used in an open area, or just tall enough not to crush creatures atop the pillar if used in a space with a confined ceiling. Creatures in the area are lifted rapidly as the mountain grows.

Foes on the ascending pillar must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save against your power DC or fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} from the sudden motion. You can choose whether to have all such creatures slam into the ceiling, if any, taking @Damage[20d6[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save against your power DC, or to gently slow down the ascent just before it reaches the ceiling. The pillar's Climb DC is 20.

Lambent Reflection.description:
You call two mirrors and then fire a stream of light, bouncing off the mirrors to redirect it up to twice. The stream takes the form of a @Template[type:line|distance:240], except you can cause the line to turn up to 90 degrees twice at the points on its length with mirrors. Foes in the area take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[fire]] damage, with effects depending on their @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save. A foe that was already limned takes a –2 circumstance penalty to their Reflex save. Even if the path intersects a foe multiple times, they only take damage once.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half fire damage and is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.5tWqbv3Iu1FlrOx6]{Limned} until the end of your next turn.

Failure The creature takes full fire damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} and limned until the end of your turn after next (for 2 rounds and then until the end of your turn).

Critical Failure The creature takes double fire damage and is dazzled and limned until the end of your turn after next (for 2 rounds and then until the end of your turn).

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.
Lambent Reflection.name: Lambent Reflection

Lantern of Revelation.name: Lantern of Revelation
Lantern of Revelation.description:
You emit a sphere of revealing light, searing those within with the truth. The sphere forms in a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] within 120 feet. Creatures in the burst take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[fire]] damage, with effects depending on their @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

Lantern of Revelation attempts to counteract illusions and effects that disguise a creature's true form on every creature that becomes limned by Lantern of Revelation, using your power DC – 10 as your counteract modifier and half your level rounded up as your counteract level. On a success, Lantern of Revelation doesn't end the counteracted effect but instead temporarily reveals the true nature behind the illusion or transformation for all to see as long as they remain limned by Lantern of Revelation.

Lantern of Revelation also attempts to counteract illusions in the area that aren't on a specific creature, surrounding them in light and revealing their true nature until the end of your turn after next (for 2 rounds and then until the end of your turn). You can choose not to counteract your own illusions within the Lantern of Revelation; to you, they represent their own form of truth.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half fire damage as is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.5tWqbv3Iu1FlrOx6]{Limned} until the end of your next turn.

Failure The creature takes full fire damage and is limned until the end of your turn after next (for 2 rounds and then until the end of your turn).

Critical Failure The creature takes double fire damage and is limned until the end of your turn after next (for 2 rounds and then until the end of your turn).

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

Lethal Curtain.name: Lethal Curtain
Lethal Curtain.description:
You trace a curtain of death across the battlefield, snuffing out the lives of those who cross it. You create a 5-foot thick curtain of death up to 10 feet high and up to @Template[type:line|distance:60]{60 feet} long in a straight line, calling forth the curtain within 120 feet.

Any creature that crosses the curtain or is occupying the curtain's area at the start of its turn takes @Damage[(ceil(@actor.level/2))d6[void]] damage, and the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} until the end of their turn. The curtain lasts until you refresh.

A creature only takes void damage from Lethal Curtain once during each of its turns, even if it starts its turn in the curtain and then crosses the curtain, or crosses the curtain several times.

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.

Life Conductor.name: Life Conductor
Life Conductor.description:
You take control of all healing and rejuvenation around you. You gain temporary Hit Points equal to twice your level, which last until you refresh. Whenever a living creature within 60 feet regains Hit Points (whether from healing magic, fast healing, regeneration, or some other means) or gains temporary Hit Points, you can choose to redirect half the healing or temporary Hit Points to a different target of your choice within 60 feet who did not gain any healing from the same effect.

If the originator of the healing is not willing to allow this, you must succeed at a counteract check, with a counteract modifier equal to your power DC – 10 and a counteract level equal to half your level rounded up, in order to do so. Your ability to control healing lasts until you refresh.

Life Rebound.name: Life Rebound
Life Rebound.description: You protect your ally from harm by causing their spent life force to stretch and rebound back to them for a fleeting moment to help them survive a follow-up attack. Choose a living creature within 30 feet. Until the next time you refresh, whenever that creature takes damage and loses actual Hit Points (not temporary Hit Points), they gain temporary Hit Points equal to the number of actual Hit Points they lost, or twice your level, whichever is lower. These temporary Hit Points only last until the end of the current creature's turn.

Life Shackles.description:
You cause your foes' life force to congeal around them into shackles, holding them down. Living foes within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] are affected depending on their @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save and their current Hit Points.

Critical Success The foe is unaffected.

Success The foe is slightly shackled by their own life force. If at maximum Hit Points, they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3}, and otherwise they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}. They can reduce or remove the stunned condition's value by an amount of their choice by choosing to lose a number of Hit Points equal to your level × the amount they wish to reduce the stunned value.

Failure As success, but the shackles are tighter, so the foe is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 4} if they're below half their maximum Hit Points, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 5} if above half their maximum Hit Points, and stunned 6 if they're at their maximum Hit Points.

Critical Failure As failure, but the shackles of life are extremely tight, and they lose a number of Hit Points equal to twice your level × the amount they wish to reduce the stunned value.
Life Shackles.name: Life Shackles

Lifeguard Bubble.description:
You create a glowing bubble that prevents leaking life energy from departing. The bubble exists in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] around you, and creatures can move in and out of the bubble effortlessly; it only traps leaking life energy. Keep track of any actual Hit Points (not temporary Hit Points) that you and your allies lose while within the bubble.

The bubble pops at the beginning of your next turn, or just before you or an ally in the bubble would reach 0 Hit Points, whichever comes first. When the bubble pops, you can heal a total of @Damage[(7+(@actor.level*7))[healing]] Hit Points, which you can distribute however you like among yourself and the allies within the bubble. As normal for a recovery effect, this can't heal an individual creature for more Hit Points than they lost while the bubble was active.

Level (+1) The healing increases by 7.
Lifeguard Bubble.name: Lifeguard Bubble

Lifestorm.name: Lifestorm
Lifestorm.description:
You call forth a vibrant storm of glowing vital energy that rains down from the sky above. The lifestorm fills a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] within 120 feet of you. If you (if you are living) or a living ally enter or start your turn in the area, you gain [[/r 10+@actor.level]] temporary Hit Points equal to 10 plus your level which last for 1 round, and undead creatures that enter or start their turn in the area take the same amount of @Damage[ (10+@actor.level)[vitality]] damage. The lifestorm lasts until you refresh.

A creature only takes vitality damage or gains temporary Hit Points from Lifestorm once during each of its turns, even if it starts its turn in the area and then enters the area.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1.

Liquefy Air.name: Liquefy Air
Liquefy Air.description:
Trigger A creature targets you with a ranged attack and you can see the attacker.

You liquefy the air between you and the creature. If it's physical, the triggering attack's ranged increment is halved, and it takes a –2 circumstance penalty if the attack was bludgeoning or slashing. The reduced range increment could result in you being beyond the attack's maximum range, in which case it automatically misses you without rolling an attack roll. You gain resistance equal to your level against acid and fire damage from the triggering attack. While your tide has no effect on this power, it still changes your tide.

Special If you're underwater, the power makes the water more viscous instead, increasing the circumstance penalty to –4 and extending the penalty and the range increment reduction to all ranged weapon attacks and ranged unarmed attacks, even if they aren't physical. However, the range increment reduction from the power isn't cumulative with the normal reduction to range increment for piercing ranged attacks underwater.

Locomotion Shred.name: Locomotion Shred
Locomotion Shred.description:
You wrap threads of force around your foe, damaging it whenever it moves. Choose a foe within 100 feet, causing it to potentially take @Damage[(2+@actor.level)[force]] damage for each 5-foot square it moved during that movement, depending on its @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save. At 15th level, the damage increases to an amount of @Damage[(3+@actor.level)[force]] damage when it moves equal to your level plus 3 damage for each 5-foot square it moved.

Critical Success The foe avoids that threads of force and is unaffected.

Success The threads of force barely snag the foe before falling off. The next time it uses a move action before the end of its next turn, it takes force damage from Locomotion Shred.

Failure The threads of force stick to the foe. It takes force damage from Locomotion Shred on its first move action of each turn until the next time you refresh. Additionally, if you reposition the target with a force power, it takes force damage equal to your level.

Critical Failure The threads become completely enmeshed around the foe. It takes force damage from Locomotion Shred on every move action until the next time you refresh. Additionally, if you reposition the target with a force power, it takes force damage equal to twice your level.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1.
Level (15h) The damage increases to 3 plus your level for each 5-foot square it moved.

Lucent Beam.name: Lucent Beam
Lucent Beam.description:
You emit a beam of light to dazzle foes in a line. You deal an amount of fire damage equal to @Damage[((1+@actor.level)d4+(ceil(@actor.level/2)))[fire]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:line|distance:30], with results depending on their @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

At 5th level, you can choose to increase the size of the line to a @Template[type:line|distance:40]{40 feet} when you use Lucent Beam, and every 4 levels thereafter you can increase the size of the line by 10 additional feet, to a maximum of @Template[type:line|distance:70]{70 feet} at 17th level.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half fire damage and is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.5tWqbv3Iu1FlrOx6]{Limned} until the end of your next turn.

Failure The creature takes full fire damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} and limned until the end of your next turn.

Critical Failure The creature takes double fire damage and is dazzled and limned until the end of your turn after next (for 2 rounds and then until the end of your turn).

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1.

Meteor.name: Meteor
Meteor.description:
You send down a meteor from above, shattering and exploding on your foes at an enormous range.

The meteor strikes down in a @Template[type:burst|distance:30] within 500 feet, dealing @Damage[(1+@actor.level)[bludgeoning]] damage to each creature in the area and explodes, dealing @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[fire]] damage to each creature in the area.

Creatures in the area make a single @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save against all the damage from the meteor.

Level (+1) The bludgeoning damage is increased by 1.

Level (+1) The damage is increased by 1d6.

Midnight Orb.name: Midnight Orb
Midnight Orb.description:
You fire off an orb of midnight at a foe. Make a @Check[type:eldamon-power-attack|defense:ac]{ranged power attack roll} against a foe within 60 feet, dealing an amount of cold damage equal to @Damage[((2+@actor.level)d4 + ceil(@actor.level /2))[cold]] damage.

At 7th level, and every 4 levels thereafter, your orb's range increases by 30 feet, to a maximum of 180 feet at 19th level. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus on the attack roll if you're shrouded.

Critical Success You deal double cold damage to the target and the target is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 2} until the end of your next turn.

Success You deal normal cold damage to the target and the target is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 1} until the end of your next turn.

Failure The orb misses but still manages to shroud the target. The target is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 1} until the end of your next turn.

Critical Failure The orb misses completely.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1.

Mjollnir.name: Mjollnir
Mjollnir.description:
You hurl a hammer of lightning into the air, where it floats, up to 120 feet away laterally and up to 60 feet above the ground. At the end of each of your turns, the hammer shoots lightning at all your foes below it vertically and within 60 feet laterally, dealing @Damage[(floor(@actor.level/2))d12[electricity]] damage, with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save. The hammer lasts until you refresh.

Level (20th) The damage increases by 1d12.

Nabu.name: Nabu
Nabu.description:
You call upon a mythical font of knowledge and origin of writing, assailing your foes all at once with a torrent of overwhelming information. Creatures you choose within 120 feet take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[mental]] damage, with effects depending on their @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} until the end of your next turn.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} until the end of your next turn and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until you refresh.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 4} until the end of your next turn and stupefied 2 until you refresh.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

Muspell.name: Muspell
Muspell.description:
You selectively juxtapose the world around you with the wellspring of elemental fire, burning away all that displeases you. The world within 500 feet momentarily seems to flicker away, replaced with only fire as far as the eye can see.

Creatures you choose within the range take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d8[fire]] damage, with a @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save to avoid the world around them being drawn for an instant into the realm of fire.

Nature Overwhelming.name: Nature Overwhelming
Nature Overwhelming.description:
You infuse your foe with wood elemental energy, overwhelming them and either sowing dense verdure or harvesting to stack masses of plant matter onto them to stun them. Choose a creature within 90 feet. The target takes @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[piercing]] with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save.

Choose to either sow or harvest.

  • Sow: You sow in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] around the creature, including in the creature's space, creating dense and brightly colored plants that greatly obstruct movement. The area is greater difficult terrain, instead of normal difficult terrain. When you harvest these dense plants, creatures with the plants in their space become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round. 
  • Harvest: You harvest plants in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] around the creature, including in the creature's space, in order to stun them. The Fortitude save effects change from a basic Fortitude save to the following.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage, and the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} as long as you harvested at least three squares of plants.

Failure The creature takes full damage and it's stunned with a stunned value equal to 1 for every three squares of plants you harvested, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} if you harvested at least nine squares.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature takes double damage and the maximum stunned condition is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 5} if you harvested at least fifteen squares.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

Nyctophobia.name: Nyctophobia
Nyctophobia.description:
You overwhelm a foe with their fear of the unknown that lies within the darkness. Choose a foe within 120 feet. The foe becomes frightened and shrouded and takes @Damage[@actor.level[cold,persistent]] damage, depending on their @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save. Creatures with greater darkvision gain a +2 circumstance bonus on their saving throw, and creatures without darkvision or low-light vision take a –2 circumstance penalty on their saving throw.

Critical Success The foe is unaffected.

Success The foe takes half persistent cold damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} and @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 1} until the end of your next turn.

Failure The foe takes full persistent cold damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 2} until the end of your next turn, then @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 1} until the persistent cold damage ends; if you Refresh during that time, the shrouded condition ends early.

Critical Failure The foe takes double persistent cold damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 3} until the end of your next turn, then @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 1} until the persistent cold damage ends; if you Refresh during that time, the shrouded condition ends early.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1.

Object Throw.name: Object Throw
Object Throw.description:
You grab a nearby unattended object with force and then fling it at a foe. Choose an unattended object of Bulk 1 or 2 within 30 feet and make a @Check[type:eldamon-power-attack|defense:ac]{power attack roll} against a foe within 120 feet to throw the object at the foe, dealing @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d8[untyped]] damage, either bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage depending on the object you chose.

If the object is made of a special material, such as silver or adamantine, the damage from Object Throw interacts with resistances, weaknesses, and the like as appropriate, but otherwise, different objects normally have no other effect, regardless of their magical or physical properties or attributes. In extremely rare circumstances, the GM might determine that other properties or attributes of the item apply.

Critical Success The object critically hits the foe, dealing double damage.

Success The object hits the foe, dealing full damage.

Failure While the object just slightly misses the foe, the surrounding threads of force readjust, and the foe still takes @Damage[(1+@actor.level)[untyped]] damage of the appropriate type.

Critical Failure The object misses completely, dealing no damage.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d8, or 1 on a failure.

Ocean Torrent.name: Ocean Torrent
Ocean Torrent.description:
You tap into your reserves of endurance to create a torrent of ocean water in a line. You deal @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d4[bludgeoning]] damage to all foes in a @Template[type:line|distance:40], with effects depending on their @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

At 7th level, you can choose to increase the size of the line to a @Template[type:line|distance:50] when you use Ocean Torrent, and every 4 levels thereafter you can increase the size of the line by 10 additional feet, to a maximum of 80 feet at 19th level.

High Tide: The damage is @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d8[bludgeoning]|options:high-tide-power] damage at the cost of your endurance. You take a –2 circumstance penalty to Fortitude saves until the end of your next turn.

Low Tide: You build your endurance by gathering the torrent to you. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Fortitude saves until the end of your next turn.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and you move them 10 feet.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and you move them 20 feet.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.Qo8ccw1GcVpmOOxd]{Effect: Ocean Torrent (High Tide)}

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.bfYTSksrTpFrN764]{Effect: Ocean Torrent (Low Tide)}

Level (+1) The damage is increased by 1d4.

Omega Wave.name: Omega Wave
Omega Wave.description:
You gather elemental energy around you and release it in an emanating wave that destroys all that surrounds you. Creatures in your choice of up to a @Template[type:emanation|distance:60] take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[untyped]] damage of the type associated with your element, with effects depending on their basic saving throw. The saving throw is @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] for most elements but @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] if your element is death, life, and poison and @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] if your element is mind.

If you spend three actions, the damage increases to @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d8[untyped]] damage and the emanation can be up to @Template[type:emanation|distance:90]{90 feet}. If you spend two full rounds (spending three actions on the turn you used the power without completing the power, then spending three more actions on your next turn to complete the power), the damage increases to @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d12[untyped]] damage and the emanation can be up to @Template[type:emanation|distance:180]{180 feet}.

Level (+1) The damage is increased by 1d6, 1d8, or 1d12.

Opportune Drain.name: Opportune Drain
Opportune Drain.description:
Trigger An ally critically succeeds at an attack roll against a foe within 30 feet.

In the moment of weakness when your ally lands a telling blow, you take advantage of the opening to drain away your foe's life force. The triggering foe becomes drained depending on its @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}.

Outstretched Shadow.name: Outstretched Shadow
Outstretched Shadow.description:
You stretch your own shadow into a line, chilling and enshrouding everything within. You deal an amount of cold damage equal to @Damage[((1+@actor.level)d4 + ceil(@actor.level/2))[cold]] damage to all creatures within an @Template[type:line|distance:80], with effects depending on their Reflex save.

If you're shrouded, you can choose to extend the line up to 120 feet. Creatures in the area who were already shrouded take a –2 circumstance penalty to their saving throw.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half cold damage.

Failure The creature takes full cold damage and is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 1} until the end of your next turn.

Critical Failure The creature takes double cold damage and is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 2} until the end of your next turn.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1.

Overflowing Spill.name: Overflowing Spill
Overflowing Spill.description:
You loosen the life energy in a living foe, causing their energy to spill out and recover their victim's wounds. Choose a foe within 30 feet. The effect depends on their @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] saving throw.

Critical Success The foe is unaffected.

Success The foe's life force briefly spills out when they harm others. For 1 round, whenever they deal damage to another living creature within 15 feet of them, the foe loses Hit Points equal to 2 plus half your level (@Damage[ 2+ floor(@actor.level /2)]) and the target heals that many (@Damage[ (2+ floor(@actor.level /2))[healing]]) Hit Points or the total damage they would take, whichever is less (this healing is a recovery effect). If they damage several living creatures within 15 feet at once, they still only lose Hit Points equal to 2 plus half your level, and the healing is divided among all the creatures they damaged.

Failure As success, except the effect lasts until you refresh.

Critical Failure As success, except the effect lasts until you refresh and the amount of Hit Points the foe loses each time it damages a creature within 15 feet (and thus the potential amount of healing) is doubled.

Padma.name: Padma
Padma.description:
You call forth a swarm of mythical lotus blossoms, whose near infinite facets reflect a quadrillion different possibilities and the creative aspects of pure wood energy. All foes within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:500] take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[piercing]] damage, with a @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save.

Sow floating lotuses within the area, including in the air. These lotuses only last until the beginning of your next turn, but they don't impede the movement of you or your allies.

Pall of Darkness.name: Pall of Darkness
Pall of Darkness.description:
You cast a pall of darkness upon a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] within 120 feet, choking out the light. Light does not enter the area and any nonmagical light sources, such as a torch or lantern, don't emanate any light while inside the area, even if their light radius would extend beyond the pall. Magical light can attempt to counteract the pall as normal.

Light can't pass through, so creatures in the area can't see outside without darkvision. From outside, the pall of darkness appears as a shrouded area of pure darkness.

The pall of darkness lasts until you refresh.

Pallid Frostbite.name: Pallid Frostbite
Pallid Frostbite.description:
You give a creature intense frostbite, making its frozen body brittle and easily harmed by physical attacks. Choose a foe within 60 feet. The target takes @Damage[(1+@actor.level)[cold]] damage and gains weakness equal to half your level to physical damage, with effects depending on its Fortitude save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage, is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 2}, and gains the weakness to physical damage until the end of your next turn.

Failure The creature takes full damage, is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 3}, and gains the weakness to physical damage for 2 rounds.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 4}, and gains twice the normal weakness to physical damage for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.4gGxZ9HGl5eqWYWq]{Effect: Pallid Frostbite}

Level (+1) The damage is increased by 1.

Path of Life.name: Path of Life
Path of Life.description:
You trail a path of vibrant healing energy behind you. You either Stride or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.21WIfSu7Xd7uKqV8]{Tumble Through}, leaving behind glimmering life energy in all the spaces you entered during that movement, which lasts until the end of your next turn. Keep track of actual Hit Points living creatures lose while they are within the Path of Life. When they start their turn in the Path of Life, they regain @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d4[healing]] Hit Points, or the amount of Hit Points they lost while within the Path of Life, whichever is less. Undead creatures that start their turn in the Path of Life, or that cross the Path of Life, take @Damage[(4+(4*@actor.level))[vitality]] damage. An undead creature only takes vitality damage from the Path of Life once, even if it starts its turn in the path and then crosses the path, or crosses the path several times. Living creatures that cross the path aren't healed.

Level (+1) The healing increases by 1d4 and the damage increases by 4.

Peaceful Impulse.name: Peaceful Impulse
Peaceful Impulse.description:
You forcibly apply a peaceful impulse to your foe's mind, making it difficult and damaging for them to take hostile actions. Choose a foe within 60 feet, with effects depending on their @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

Critical Success The foe is unaffected.

Success For 1 round, the foe takes mental damage equal to @Damage[(1+@actor.level)[mental]] each time they take a hostile action and takes a –1 circumstance penalty to their attack rolls, skill checks, and DCs used to perform hostile actions. If the foe uses a hostile activity with several subordinate actions (such as an activity that allows it to Strike every creature within reach), it only takes damage once.

Failure As success, but the effect lasts until you refresh.

Critical Failure As success, but the mental damage is equal to 6 plus your level, the circumstance penalty is a –2 circumstance penalty, and the effect lasts until you refresh.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.4ou27ma4vEO0C1O9]{Effect: Peaceful Impulse}

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1.

Peregrine Gust.name: Peregrine Gust
Peregrine Gust.description:
You send forth a fierce cutting gust, which travels a great distance through your foes. The gust takes the form of a @Template[type:line|distance:500], except you can cause the line to turn up to 90 degrees once at any point along its length. Foes in the area take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d8[slashing]], with a @Check[type:Reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save.

Level (+1) The damage is increased by 1d8.

Petrifying Dust.name: Petrifying Dust
Petrifying Dust.description:
You breathe a cone of dust that stiffens your foes, making their movements clumsy and causing internal bludgeoning, eventually petrifying them. Foes in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d4[bludgeoning]] damage and might become clumsy, depending on their @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes full damage but shakes off the petrification and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature takes full damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}. At the end of each of its turns, a creature with the clumsy condition from Petrifying Dust must attempt an ongoing Fortitude save. On a failed save, the clumsy condition increases by 1 (or 2 on a critical failure). A successful save reduces the clumsy condition by 1 (or removes it entirely on a critical success); these ongoing saves have the incapacitation trait. If a creature reaches @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 4} from Petrifying Dust, it becomes petrified permanently.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature takes triple damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3}.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.

Phantom Raid.description:
You split off countless shadow duplicates of yourself to attack all nearby foes. Each foe within 120 feet of you takes @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d4[cold]] damage, with results depending on your @Check[type:eldamon-power-attack|defense:ac]{melee power attack rolls} for each of the raiding shadows.

If you were shrouded and either @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} when you used Shadow Raid, you can end the shrouded condition to add @Damage[((1+@actor.level)d4[precision])[cold]] damage (if you were hidden or undetected to only some of your foes, you can still make this choice, but the foes who were observing you don't take the additional precision damage).

Critical Success The foe takes double cold damage (and precision damage, if any).

Success The foe takes full cold damage (and precision damage, if any).

Failure The attack is slightly off the mark. The foe takes half cold damage and doesn't take any precision damage.

Critical Failure The attack misses.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.
Phantom Raid.name: Phantom Raid

Phlegethon.name: Phlegethon
Phlegethon.description:
You evoke a raging river of flame to stymie your foes' advance and leave them nothing more than charred husks. You create a river of flame up to 30-feet wide, up to 20 feet deep, and up to 120 feet long in either a straight line or single curved arc, calling forth the river within 500 feet. You can create the river on the ground or even in mid-air; the raging torrent of flames defies gravity.

The river of flame is greater difficult terrain when Striding or Flying through it, though creatures can choose to attempt to Swim through the river if that would be faster than Striding or Flying through greater difficult terrain.

Any creature that crosses the river or is occupying the river's area at the start of its turn takes @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d4[fire]] damage. The river lasts until you refresh.

A creature only takes fire damage from Phlegethon once during each of its turns, even if it starts its turn in the river and then crosses the river, or spends several actions crossing the river. However, if it takes more than one turn to cross the river, it takes damage again on each of its turns.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.

Phrenic Curtain.name: Phrenic Curtain
Phrenic Curtain.description:
You trace a curtain of rippling mental energy across the battlefield, damaging and stupefying foes that move through. You create a 5-foot thick curtain of mental energy up to 10 feet high and up to @Template[type:line|distance:60]{60 feet long} in a straight line, calling forth the curtain within 120 feet. Any creature that crosses the curtain or is occupying the curtain's area at the start of its turn takes @Damage[(ceil(@actor.level/2))d6[mental]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until the beginning of their next turn. The curtain lasts until you refresh.

A creature only takes mental damage and the stupefied effect from Phrenic Curtain once during each of its turns, even if it starts its turn in the curtain and then crosses the curtain, or crosses the curtain several times.

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.

Pinpoint Singularity.name: Pinpoint Singularity
Pinpoint Singularity.description:
You condense an enormous amount of elemental energy into an infinitesimal singularity at the tip of your finger or appendage, then release it into your foe with explosive power. Make an attack roll against a creature within your reach.

You deal @Damage[(2+@actor.level)d10[untyped]] damage of the type associated with your element, with effects depending on your @Check[type:eldamon-power-attack|defense:ac]{power attack roll}.

Critical Success You deal double damage to the target.

Success You deal normal damage to the target.

Failure Your singularity catches the target at the edge, dealing @Damage[ 2+@actor.level] damage.

Critical Failure Your attack misses completely.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d10, or 1 on a failure.

Polar Rime.name: Polar Rime
Polar Rime.description:
You surround your target with algid polar rime, stiffening its body and making its movements jerky and clumsy. Choose a creature within 90 feet. The target takes @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d8[cold]] damage and becomes clumsy while it remains frozen, with effects depending on their @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save. If it ever ends the frozen condition, it's no longer clumsy, even if you later give it the frozen condition again.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage, becomes @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 2}, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} as long as it remains frozen.

Failure The creature takes full damage, becomes @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 3}, and becomes clumsy as long as it remains frozen with a value equal to half its frozen value, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 4} with a frozen value of 8 or higher. As the creature's frozen value increases or decreases, its clumsy value changes accordingly.

Critical Failure As failure, except the creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 5}.

Level (+1) The damage is increased by 1d8.

Polarize.name: Polarize
Polarize.description:
You electrically polarize a target, causing it to become charged as electricity surges through them, jolting them over and over. You deal @Damage[(ceil(@actor.level/2))d4[persistent,electricity]] damage to a target within 30 feet, with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save. On a failure they become @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.1fZbuJEbVmE3J4XL]{Shocked} for 2 rounds. This persistent electricity damage from Polarize doesn't discharge their shocked condition, as normal. Choose one:

  • You either become @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Bi2aHykg6CZrQCnR]{Charged}
  • You discharge to increase the persistent electricity damage to @Damage[(@actor.level)d4[persistent,electricity]] damage.

Level (+1) The damage on discharge increases by 1d4.

Level (+2) The normal damage increases by 1d4.

Predict Assaults.name: Predict Assaults
Predict Assaults.description:
As you restructure the mental energies surrounding you, you get a read on what your foes are thinking, making it incredibly easy for you to avoid their attacks and blasts. You Refresh your powers. You then read the combat intentions of all foes within 60 feet of you.

Until the next time you Refresh, for each of those foes, you either roll twice and take the higher result on your first Reflex save against the foe or the foe rolls twice and takes the lower result on its first attack roll against you, whichever of the two comes first for that foe. If you roll twice and take the higher result, it's a fortune effect, and if you force the foe to roll twice and take the lower results, it's a misfortune effect.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.On9REqLmUydHRyBt]{Effect: Predict Assaults}

Preserve Life.name: Preserve Life
Preserve Life.description:
You reach out to the life forces of your allies around you in order to refresh your life powers, and you gather their spilled vital energy so they can try to collect it again. You Refresh your powers.

Until the end of your next turn, keep track of how many actual Hit Points (not including temporary Hit Points) you and your allies lose, as you collect their spilled vital energy momentarily. During this time, if an ally ends their turn next to you, they recover @Damage[(6+@actor.level)[healing]] Hit Points; however, they can't gain more healing in this way than the number of Hit Points they lost. At the start of your next turn, you recover @Damage[(6+@actor.level)[healing]] Hit Points, with the same limitation that you can't gain more healing in this way than the number of Hit Points you lost.

Level (+1) The healing increases by 1.

Prism's Refraction.name: Prism's Refraction
Prism's Refraction.description:
You refract light in front of you like a prism into a cone of brilliant rays. You deal an amount of fire damage equal to @Damage[((1+(@actor.level))d4+(ceil(@actor.level/2)))[fire]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40], with results depending on their @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save. Creatures that were already limned take a –2 circumstance penalty to their Reflex save against Prism's Refraction.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half fire damage and is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.5tWqbv3Iu1FlrOx6]{Limned} until the end of your next turn.

Failure The creature takes full fire damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} and limned until the end of your next turn.

Critical Failure The creature takes double fire damage and is dazzled and limned until the end of your turn after next (for 2 rounds and then until the end of your turn).

Level (+1) The damage is increased by 1d4.
Level (+2) The damage is increased by 1.

Protective Shock.name: Protective Shock
Protective Shock.description:
Trigger An adjacent foe hits you with a melee attack, a foe hits you with a melee unarmed attack, or a foe hits you with a melee attack with a metal weapon

You attempt to briefly zap an attacker, attempting to stun them just long enough to cancel the attack. The triggering foe must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save against your power DC. On a failure, the attack is disrupted.

Before they roll the Fortitude save, you can choose to discharge. If you do and they fail the save, they also lose 1 of their remaining actions for the turn (similar to being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}, but the effect is applied immediately on their turn).

Psychic Scream.name: Psychic Scream
Psychic Scream.description:
Trigger A creature targets you with a magical mental effect, or you're in the area of a creature's magical mental effect

Those who seek to intrude upon your mind have made a huge blunder. You release a psychic scream into the intruding mind, damaging and disrupting it. The triggering creature takes @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[mental]] damage, with effects depending on their @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

Apply the stupefied condition from Psychic Scream before assessing the effect of the creature's magical mental effect (this could give the creature a status penalty or cause a flat check to disrupt the effect).

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until the end of your next turn.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} until the end of your next turn.

Critical Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} until the end of your next turn. You are unaffected by the triggering mental effect (though if it's an area effect or has multiple targets, it might affect other creatures).

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

Puppetmaster.description:
Using threads of force to puppet their legs or other ambulatory limbs against their will, you attempt to take control of a foe's locomotion, controlling where it moves with all its move actions until it breaks free.

Choose a creature within 60 feet. The target is affected depending on its @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save. The target can break free of your control and end the effect early by ripping off the threads of force, either by [[/act escape dc=resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)]]{Escaping} against your power DC or by spending three actions, which have the manipulate trait, to carefully remove them.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The next time the target attempts to move, you nearly control its movement, but it manages to stave the control off. The move action is disrupted, and Puppetmaster's effect ends. If the target doesn't attempt to move, the effect lasts until you refresh or the target Escapes or removes the threads.

Failure The next time the target attempts to move, you control the movement from all the target's move actions for 1 round. The effect ends early if you refresh, if the target Escapes, or if it removes the threads.

Critical Failure You control the movement from all the target's move actions. The effect ends early if you refresh, if the target Escapes, or if it removes the threads.
Puppetmaster.name: Puppetmaster

Rahu Ketu.name: Rahu Ketu
Rahu Ketu.description:
You call upon two mythical lunar nodes who work together to cause eclipses, bringing forth a sudden eclipse that ends the light. All light ceases to shine within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:200] for 1 minute, and even the sun is eclipsed over that range (though the sun shines normally across the rest of the planet).

Foes within the eclipsed area must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save, with the following effects. Creatures with greater darkvision gain a +2 circumstance bonus on their saving throw.

Critical Success The foe is unaffected.

Success The foe is barely shaken by the dying of the light. They become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The foe is deeply unsettled by the dying of the light. They become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The foe is truly terrified by the dying of the light. They become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.

Reap Lives.description:
You snuff out lives on the brink of death as you refresh your death powers. Each foe within @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} takes @Damage[(max(1,floor(@actor.level/2)))[void]]{void damage} equal to half your level (minimum 1), and then they might die, depending on their @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

If this kills any foes, or if there are foes in the area who died since the beginning of your last turn (typically because you killed them with your previous death power), you gain a +1 status bonus on Perception checks, saving throws, and skill checks until the end of your next turn. Either way, you Refresh your powers.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.aBgD16MCKAhuBf09]{Effect: Reap Lives}

Critical Success The foe is unaffected.

Success The foe takes full damage.

Failure The foe takes full damage. After applying the damage, if the foe has 1 Hit Points, it is reduced to 0 Hit Points.

Critical Failure As failure, but the foe takes double damage instead of full damage.
Reap Lives.name: Reap Lives

Reaping Refresh.name: Reaping Refresh
Reaping Refresh.description:
You reap what you sowed, drawing upon the wood energy to help you refresh your powers. All foes in areas with plants you sowed take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)[piercing]] damage, with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save. You then Refresh your powers.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1.

Reborn in Flames.name: Reborn in Flames
Reborn in Flames.description:
Flames consume you and you emerge from within them cleansed and with your inner fire refreshed. As you slough off your outer form, you end all persistent damage on yourself, attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} from effects giving you the grabbed or immobilized condition, attempt a saving throw against the sickened condition, and attempt a saving throw against any poisons currently affecting you.

If you roll a failure or critical failure on any poison saves from Reborn in Flames, instead of progressing the poison, you don't take any further effect. You Refresh your powers.

Rebounding Embrace.name: Rebounding Embrace
Rebounding Embrace.description:
You harden your body, rebounding and bashing those who attempt to harm you. Until you refresh, adjacent creatures that hit you with a melee attack, as well as creatures that touch you or hit you with an unarmed attack, take @Damage[@actor.level[bludgeoning]] damage. If you have resistance against physical damage or a circumstance bonus to AC, this damage is increased by half your level to @Damage[(@actor.level + floor(@actor.level/2))[bludgeoning]].

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1.

Recharge.name: Recharge
Recharge.description: You draw upon electric charge while creating a complex matrix of electrical energy to ready your powers. You become @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Bi2aHykg6CZrQCnR]{Charged}, and then you Refresh your powers.

Reflect Projectiles.name: Reflect Projectiles
Reflect Projectiles.description:
Trigger A foe targets you with a physical ranged attack and you are aware of the attack or ability

With a gust of wind, you reflect the projectile away, potentially onto a foe. You gain a +4 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack, and against any further physical ranged attacks until the end of the current creature's turn. If any such attacks are critical failures, you can redirect them to another target within range, making a @Check[eldamon-power-attack|against:ac]{power attack roll} to determine if the attack hits but using the original ranged attack's damage and effects. You can't use this power to deflect unusually massive ranged projectiles (such as boulders or ballista bolts).

Relentless Drench.description:
You drench a foe within 120 feet, waterlogging them until they are clumsy and slow. They take @Damage[((1+@actor.level)d4)[bludgeoning]] damage, with effects depending on their @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

High Tide: The damage is @Damage[((1+@actor.level)d8)[bludgeoning]|options:high-tide-power] damage, but the water drenches you too and you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} until the end of your next turn.

Low Tide: The waters that drench your foe help you take action. On your next turn, you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} and can use the additional action to Step, Stride, Strike, Swim (if you have a swim Speed), or use Elemental Shield if you have it.

Critical Success The foe is unaffected.

Success The foe takes half damage, you move them 5 feet, and they are clumsy 2 until the end of your next turn.

Failure The foe takes full damage, you move them 10 feet, and they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round, clumsy 2 until the end of your next turn and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until you refresh.

Critical Failure The foe takes double damage, you move them 20 feet, and they are slowed 1 for 1 round, clumsy 2 until the end of your next turn, and clumsy 1 for 1 minute.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d4, or 1d8 on high tide.
Relentless Drench.name: Relentless Drench

Retributive Burn.name: Retributive Burn
Retributive Burn.description:
Trigger A creature adjacent to you hits you with an attack, or a creature hits you with a melee unarmed attack

When an enemy dares to strike you, you set them ablaze. The triggering creature takes @Damage[(1+@actor.level)[persistent,fire]] damage with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1.

Retributive Dazzle.name: Retributive Dazzle
Retributive Dazzle.description:
Trigger A foe would hit you with a melee attack

When an enemy strikes you in melee, you dazzle and limn them just before it hits until the beginning of its next turn. If the triggering attack didn't already require a flat check to target you due to concealment, the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} condition, or the like, the enemy must immediately attempt the flat check due to being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled}, and on a failure, the attack fails.

Retributive Mindlink.name: Retributive Mindlink
Retributive Mindlink.description:
Trigger A creature hits you with a melee attack.

You use your foe's attack to establish a mental link to that foe, opening them up to your other mind powers. They must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save with the following effects.

Critical Success The foe is unaffected.

Success The foe takes a –1 circumstance penalty to its Will saves against your mind powers for 1 round. During that time, it also gain weakness equal to 1 plus half your level to mental damage from your first mental power that damages it. After taking the additional damage from the weakness once, the weakness ends.

Failure As success, but the foe takes a –2 circumstance penalty to its Will saves against your mind powers, and the weakness is equal to 1 plus your level.

Critical Failure As success, but the foe takes a –3 circumstance penalty to its Will saves against your mind powers, and the weakness is equal to 2 plus twice your level.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.02zTjXrTz67CTGF7]{Effect: Retributive Mindlink}

Retributive Rejuvenation.name: Retributive Rejuvenation
Retributive Rejuvenation.description:
Trigger A foe deals damage to you.

You convert the energy of your foe's assault into life energy, rejuvenating yourself from harm. You gain fast healing for 2 rounds equal to 4 plus half your level, or half the amount of actual Hit Points (not temporary Hit Points) you lost from the triggering damage, whichever is less.

As normal for a recovery effect, this fast healing can't heal you for more than the amount of Hit Points you lost, even if you receive another recovery effect or have an effect that increases the amount of healing.

Retributive Shock.name: Retributive Shock
Retributive Shock.description:
Trigger An adjacent foe hits you with a melee attack, a foe hits you with a melee unarmed attack, or a foe hits you with a melee attack with a metal weapon

Whenever an enemy dares to strike you, you take the opportunity to shock them with electricity, making them more vulnerable to your follow-up electric attacks. The triggering foe takes @Damage[(1+(floor(@actor.level/2)))[electricity]]{electricity damage} equal to 1 plus half your level and must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save, with the following effects.

Before they roll the Reflex save, you can choose to discharge in order to more effectively push your charge off onto your foe and shock them. If you do, they use the result one degree of success worse than the one they rolled.

Critical Success The foe avoids the charge entirely and is unaffected.

Success The foe takes no damage and then becomes @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.1fZbuJEbVmE3J4XL]{Shocked} until the end of your next turn.

Failure The foe takes full damage and then becomes shocked for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The foe takes double damage and then becomes shocked for 1 minute.

Retributive Shroud.name: Retributive Shroud
Retributive Shroud.description:
Trigger An adjacent foe hits you with a melee attack or a foe hits you with a melee unarmed attack

When an enemy strikes you in close quarters, you shroud them in darkness to avoid follow-up attacks. The triggering foe becomes shrouded until the end of their turn, depending on their @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save against your power DC.

Critical Success The foe avoids the descending shroud and is completely unaffected.

Success The foe is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 1} until the end of their turn.

Failure The foe is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 2} until the end of their turn.

Critical Failure The foe is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 3} until the end of their turn.

Retributive Sow.description:
Trigger A creature hits you with an attack

When a foe hits you with an attack, in melee or at range, you seize the momentary connection and send out floating seeds to surround them with plants. You sow in that foe's space and all spaces adjacent to them.
Retributive Sow.name: Retributive Sow

Retributive Wave.name: Retributive Wave
Retributive Wave.description:
Trigger A creature hits you with a melee attack.

You call forth a wave to knock your foe toward you or away from you, depending on your tide. They must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save with the following effects.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature chooses whether to let you move it 5 feet or to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the end of its next turn.

Failure You move the creature 10 feet. If you're at low tide and the creature was already next to you, it becomes off-guard until the end of its next turn.

Critical Failure You move the creature 20 feet. If you're at low tide and the creature was already next to you, it becomes off-guard for 2 rounds.

Retributive Weakening.name: Retributive Weakening
Retributive Weakening.description:
Trigger A creature adjacent to you hits you with an attack, or a creature hits you with a melee unarmed attack

Those who fight against death do little more than weaken themself in a futile effort. The creature becomes enfeebled based on its @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save. The enfeebled condition applies before rolling damage for the triggering attack.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} until the end of its next turn.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} until the end of its next turn.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 4} until the end of its next turn.

Ride the Lightning.name: Ride the Lightning
Ride the Lightning.description:
You transform into lightning and surge forward in a straight line. The lightning you become shoots out in a line up to 120 feet. Creatures in the area take @Damage[(ceil(@actor.level/2))d12[electricity]] damage, with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save.

Your movement as lightning still trigger reactions, but very few effects can actually affect you when you're lightning unless they counteract Ride the Lightning or directly divert a lightning bolt. At the end of the line, you transform back into your original form, having moved the intervening distance.

Choose one:

  • You either become @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Bi2aHykg6CZrQCnR]{Charged}
  • You discharge to increase the damage to @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d12[electricity]] damage and increase the maximum length of the line to 240 feet.

Level (+1) The damage on discharge increases by 1d12.

Level (+2) The normal damage increases by 1d12.

Rigor Mortis.name: Rigor Mortis
Rigor Mortis.description:
You unleash a rigid line of death that partially necrotizes those within, stiffening their bodies and ruining their dexterity. You deal @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d4[void]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:line|distance:30], with effects depending on their Fortitude save.

At 7th level, and every 4 levels thereafter, you can increase the length of the line by 5 additional feet, to a maximum of a @Template[type:line|distance:50] at 19th level.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is slightly necrotized, taking half damage, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until the end of their next turn.
